pages.title: ⍟ Page of Pentacles ⍟
pages.text: Rose of the Palace of Earth$(br)      $(m)∇$() Earth of $(m)∇$() Earth

A youthful figure, has a pentacle hovering lightly over their raised hand. They examine it intently, as if to analyze it deeply and understand its nature.$(br)  Moving slowly, they seem insensible of that which is about them in the grassy field.$(br)  Not very far, a small patch of trees and a newly ploughed field, indicates abundance and fresh opportunities.$(br)  This card represents the power to displace our own physicality into things outside

of ourselves, especially work and anything that fascinates or distracts us from our surroundings.$(br)  They are the virgin Earth ready to be molded and transformed by wherever life leads. $(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Involvement with nature, fascination with the world.$(br)  Can mean a changing of a line of work or a need to reflect on application.$(br)  Possibly a student, or the
idea of studying new things.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Prodigality, dissipation, liberality.$(br)  Can signify someone whimsical, easily distracted.
